RootCure AI is a smart platform that helps organisations:

  1. Capture and categorize problems (IT, safety, compliance, HR, etc.)
  2. Analyse historical data to detect root causes using patterns
  3. Recommend cures or preventive actions, using a knowledge base of past resolutions and AI suggestions
  4. Trigger automated workflows to implement fixes or escalate to the right teams
  5. Document and share learnings for future use across the organisation
  6. Monitor repeat incidents and flag systemic issues

 

Potential Impact will be :-

  1. Reduces repeat incidents and service disruptions
  2. Accelerates problem resolution with data-backed cures
  3. Builds a culture of continuous improvement and learning
  4. Improves employee safety, wellbeing, and operational efficiency
  5. Encourages cross-departmental collaboration in tackling recurring issues
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
In many organisations, recurring operational issues — whether IT incidents, environmental non-compliance, HR concerns, or safety hazards — are treated at the symptom level, not the root cause. This leads to repeated disruptions, wasted time, and higher costs.
There’s a clear gap in providing a centralised system that not only identifies the root causes of problems but also suggests appropriate, proven cures based on past resolutions and AI-driven recommendations.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  1. AI Agentic Studio - fro configure the AI Agents and utilised the OOB tools (Scripts, Flow, Search Retrivals) from there
  2. App Engine Studio – for building custom dashboards, forms, and workflows
  3. Flow Designer – to automate follow-up actions or escalations
  4. Performance Analytics – to track root causes and recurrence rates
  5. Predictive Intelligence / Machine Learning – to suggest likely causes and recommended actions
  6. Knowledge Management – to maintain a living “Cause & Cure” library
  7. Surveys & Assessments – to gather user feedback after cures are applied
  8. Virtual Agent (optional) – to guide users through self-resolution paths

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. Historical data from incident/problem/compliance records
  2. Accurate categorization/tagging for better AI suggestion
  3. Access to build custom tables, relationships, and UI components
  4. Predictive Intelligence plugin (if using AI for suggestions)

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Ensuring quality and consistency in data for root cause analysis
  2. Building trust in AI recommendations (human validation may be needed)
  3. User adoption of a new process when they’re used to quick fixes 
  4. Integration with different departments or systems for cross-functional use
